_exec_summary.SummaryText:
OnLine Packaging, Incorporated manufactures bleach and windshield washer solution at their plant in Ardmore, Oklahoma.  Chlorine, a substance considered hazardous by the Environmental Protection Agency (EPA), is used to manufacture bleach at this facility.  Because chlorine is a regulated substance, OnLine Packaging, Inc. must comply with the EPA?s Chemical Accident Prevention regulations (40 CFR Part 68).  Compliance involves developing and implementing a risk management plan (RMP), and submitting this RMP to the EPA.

At the OnLine Packaging, Inc. plant in Ardmore, Oklahoma, the maximum inventory of chlorine on site is a 90-ton tank car located on a railroad spur adjacent to the building.  Liquid chlorine is piped from the tank car into the building where it is reacted, under carefully controlled conditions, with caustic soda to produce bleach for consumer use.  The chlorine systems are designed and operated in accordance with Chlorine Institute recommendations, and the employees of OnLine Packaging, Inc. use appropriate safety precautions in handling chlorine to prevent accidental releases and minimize any hazard to human health or the environment.

The Ardmore plant is starting up in 2007 and therefore has never had an accidental release of chlorine in any quantity.  OnLine Packaging, Inc. also operates plants in Michigan City, Indiana, and in Plover, Wisconsin, neither of which have ever had an accidental release of chlorine in any quantity.  However, in the event of an emergency involving chlorine, this emergency response plan calls for certain internal procedures and actions to be taken in addition to the immediate notification of the Ardmore Airpark Fire Department, the National Emergency Response Center, and the Chemical Transportation Emergency Center (CHEMTREC). In addition, the Employee Emergency Action Plan is implemented whenever the safety of employees is at risk.  The plan identifies outside agencies that will be notified and establishes procedure fo

r evacuating personnel.

OnLine Packaging, Inc. complies with the EPA?s Chemical Accident Prevention regulations and with all applicable state codes and regulations.  Since this is a new facility, no changes are planned at this time that will alter the effectiveness of this RMP.  However, if continued operations indicate the need, changes will be implemented, and this RMP will be updated to ensure continued compliance with EPA standards.
